body: Can this be reproduced without any application running inside of Alacritty and without mouse mode enabled? So just by starting a selection?
Yes, it can be reproduced with a double click that selects text. Mouse clicks are triggered at the position where the pointer was before the alacritty window loses and regains focus.
Just to make sure, when running `alacritty --print-events`, are new events actually printed when moving the mouse over the window while it is not focused?

Thanks for testing, that sounds like it's because of our dependency winit not handling this correctly on macOS. Which should also mean that it works on other platforms (I'm not able to reproduce on Linux).

Could you confirm that this is the case by running `cargo run --example window` in the https://github.com/rust-windowing/glutin example? That should also not show any events while the window is not focused, if it really is because of our dependency.
Sorry, I don't currently have a rust development environment setup on this computer. If you know someone else that does and could test they might be able to get you an answer faster.

Tried it but I'm getting this when running it:


issue.title: No mouse events when unfocused on macOS

labels.name: C - needs investigation
labels.description: Issue must be confirmed and researched

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2475.

It looks like winit does not report mouse movements inside the window if it is currently unfocused. This makes it difficult to track mouse click positions since the mouse can "teleport" into position without being able to track it.

If this is an intentional design decision, I think that there's no way around reporting mouse position on click events, since a click might come in without any previous motion events at all.

This could be resolved with https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/883, but it might still make sense to report motions above the unfocused window, since I'm pretty sure other platforms do that?

issue.title: MacOS Command key state isn't updated
issue.body:
### System

OS: macOS
Version: alacritty 0.4.1 (4d9253b)

### Issue
Switching away from alacritty and returning using `Command`+`Tab` sometimes causes the alacritty to believe the `Command` key is still depressed. In some ways this is similar to #2475 but I am a daily user of alacritty and I immediately started noticing this issue on my recent update from v0.3.3 to v0.4.1.

The way to trigger this is to "slow" `Command`+`Tab` away from alacritty. By that I mean: 
1) Press `Command`+`Tab` and release `Tab` but keep `Command` pressed. This should open an application switching view.
2) Tap the `Tab` key to cycle between open applications. 
3) Release the `Command` key to switch to the application selected in the switcher (something other than alacritty).
4) Now return to alacritty either with a regular "fast" `Command`+`Tab` (not opening the application switcher view) or by using the mouse.
5) The `Command` key is now in a depressed state in alacritty.

This compounds with another open issue #3426 because now if I press `q` alacritty instantly quits even though my fingers are not touching the `Command` key.
